lang.item: The importer found multiple import data files. Please choose the one you wish to use.
If the software you're looking for doesn't appear above, please check to see if it is available for download at Github. If it isn't, we may be able to write one for you - just ask us!
If you're having any other problems with this importer, don't hesitate to look for help.
The importer did not find any import data files. Please check to see if the one you want is available for download at Github. If it isn't, we may be able to write one for you - just ask us!
After you download it, simply upload it into the same folder as this import.php file. If you're having any other problems with this importer, don't hesitate to look for help.
This importer was unable to find %s in the path you specified. Please double check the path, and that it is already installed there.

The importer detected that your host has open_basedir enabled on this server. Please ask your host to disable this setting or try moving the contents of your %s to the public html folder of your site.
Unable to find the settings for %s. Please double check the path and try again.
The database password you entered was incorrect. Please make sure you are using the right password and try it again. If in doubt, use the password from Settings.php.
You must select at least one step to import.

Sorry, the database connection information used in the specified installation of your forum cannot access the installation of %2$s. This may either mean that the installation doesn't exist, or that the MySQL account used does not have permissions to access it.

The error MySQL gave was: %1$s'

This importer assumes you have already installed the destination forum and that your installation is working properly. It copies members, posts and other data from your "source" installation of %s into the destination forum, so it won't work without an installation of your destination forum.

All or some of the data in your installation of your destination forum will be overwritten.
The importer should only need to know where the two installations are, after which it should be able to handle everything for itself.
The importer need to know in to which software you are importing your forum.
This may be the right path.
You will need to change the value in this box.
If this is the wrong software, you can go back and pick a different data file.
Congratulations, the importer has completed successfully.
Please check this box to delete the importer right now for security reasons.
The importer has paused a few seconds to avoid overloading your server. Don't worry though, nothing's wrong.
Now that everything is imported, your destination forum should have all the data from the %s installation.
We hope you had a smooth transition!
invalid path, installation could not be validated!
